title: A Man Drives into a Crowd: A Sad Story
summary: Paul Doyle was a former marine who seemed like a nice neighbor. He talked to people and gardened. But one day, he drove his big car into a crowd of people watching a parade in Liverpool. Many were hurt, including children and older people. He said he was not guilty at first, but then he changed his mind and admitted he did it on purpose. Police say it was a planned act of violence. Neighbors were surprised because he was friendly. Now, he will go to prison for a long time. This story shows how someone can do something very bad even if they seem good.

background_read: This article is about a crime where a man drove his car into a crowd during a parade. Parades are fun events where people celebrate, like when a sports team wins. In this case, it was for Liverpool FC, a famous football team. The man, Paul Doyle, was a former marine, which means he was in the military. He lived in a quiet neighborhood with his family. Neighbors thought he was friendly, so they were shocked when he did this violent act. The police used evidence like dashcam footage to show he did it on purpose. Now, he faces prison time for hurting people.

WHAT: He drove his car into a crowd, hurting many people

WHY: He made a choice to be violent, though it's not clear why he did it
